intro: Paraquilegia gemmifolia, commonly known as the gemmiferous paraquilegia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences of small, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its stems are often hairy. The species is notable for its unique reproductive strategy, producing gemmae—small vegetative propagules—that allow it to spread efficiently in its native habitat.
